intro: Illecebrum lupulinum, commonly known as the yellow tangleweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are finely divided and form a dense, tangled mass, giving it its common name. Illecebrum lupulinum is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
